courseInfo.program: Electronics and Communication Engineering, Power Electronics
courseInfo.branch: Electronics and Communication Engineering, Power Electronics

rationale: The engineering diploma holders are required to use and maintain various types of electronically controlled equipment. The fundamental principles of electronics are to be applied in most of the situations to arrive at the probable solutions which is faced in the world of work, therefore the knowledge of the functions of various basic electronic devices and components and practical skills acquired through the laboratory experiments will help them, when they work with electronic equipment and its sub-circuits. This course is designed to develop the skills to use the basics electronic components and apply the knowledge to maintain the various types of electronic circuits.
competency: Use principles of basic electronics to maintain various electronics circuits and equipment.

courseOutcomes.description: Use basic active and passive electronic components.
Develop different types of rectifiers using PN junction diode.
Use special purpose diodes for different applications.

unitOutcomes.description: Compare active and passive components.
Explain the calculation of color coding technique for resistance calculation.
Compare specifications of various types of capacitors.
Differentiate various types of resistors, capacitors and Inductors on the basis of construction and working principle.
Describe the applications of given type of passive component.

topics.title: Introduction to electronics, Brief History of electronic components, active and passive components

Resistors: Concept of resistors, specification of resistor, classification of resistors, fixed type and variable type resistors with applications, color coding of resistors, Light dependent resistor (LDR) - symbol and working

Capacitors: Concept of capacitor, Classification of capacitors, capacitors specifications, fixed capacitor, specification and application of ceramic disk capacitor, polyester capacitor, mica capacitor, aluminum electrolytic capacitor, tantalum capacitor, variable capacitor- application of air gang PVC gang and Trimmer capacitor - mica, Coding of capacitors using directly printed codes and color band system

Inductors: Faraday's laws of electromagnetic induction self-inductance, mutual inductance, inductor specifications, introduction to air core, iron core and ferrite core inductor, toroidal inductor, Color coding of inductors

unitOutcomes.description: Describe the characteristics of PN junction diode.
Compare performance of various types of rectifiers.
Calculate ripple factor, ripple frequency, PIV and efficiency of the given type of rectifier.
Justify the selection of specific type of rectifier for the given application.
Discuss function of shunt capacitor and Pi-filter

topics.title: PN Junction diode: P-type and N-type semiconductor, construction of PN junction diode, symbol, working and characteristics of PN junction diode, Forward voltage drops, reverse leakage current, power dissipation, breakdown voltage, Peak inverse voltage (PIV)
Rectifier: Need of rectifier, definition, types of rectifiers

Half wave rectifier, full wave centre tap and bridge rectifier, output voltage, current, ripple voltage, ripple factor, ripple frequency, PIV of a diode, transformer utilization factor, efficiency of half wave and full wave rectifiers
Filters: Need and applications of rectifier filters, types of filters: shunt capacitor & Pie filter

unitOutcomes.description: Describe the working of the Zener voltage regulator circuit.
List applications of the given type of diode.
Describe working principle of LED.

topics.title: Zener diode: Symbol, construction, characteristics and application as a voltage regulator
Symbol, construction, and application of Varactor diode, Schottky barrier diode, Crystal diode
Symbol, construction and application of Photodiode, Light Emitting Diode (LED) and Multi color LED

unitOutcomes.description: Describe working principle of PNP and NPN transistors with the help of suitable sketch.
Explain the operation of transistor for the given biasing between emitter base and collector.
Sketch the Input-output characteristics curve and calculate the current gain for the given transistor configuration.
Explain function of transistor as switch in cut off and application of saturation region.
Interpret transistor data-sheets

topics.title: Transistor NPN and PNP symbol, construction, working, amplifying action, important specifications of transistor
Transistor Configuration and input output characteristics of NPN transistors in Common base (CB), Common emitter (CE) and Common collector (CC) configuration
Relation between current gain of CB, CE and CC configuration, alpha, beta and gamma of transistor
Transistor as switch in cutoff and saturation region
Application of transistor as Common emitter amplifier
Interpret data sheets and choose transistor for given application based on polarity, material, Vcbo, Vceo, Icmax, hfe, Ft, Ptot (Power dissipation total) and package type (TO-3, SMT etc.)

unitOutcomes.description: Justify the need of electronic waste methods.
Establish the relationship between sustainability and electronic waste management.
Suggest methods of handling electronic waste.
Suggest methods to dispose electronic waste safely.

topics.title: Concept of electronic waste
Sustainability and electronic waste management
Methods to handle electronic waste
Strategies of electronic waste management in the small electronics Industries

practicalExercises.description: Use Digital Multimeter to measure basic electrical parameters like current, voltage and resistance.
Use CRO to measure electrical parameters of different types of signals obtain from Function generator.
Measure resistance, capacitances and inductances of different type of resistors, capacitors and inductors using LCR meter and verify it through color code and numerical code.
Test the performance of LDR and measure the variation in resistance with the change in light intensity.
Test the performance of PN junction diode and obtain forward Voltage drop and diode current.
Build and test the half wave rectifier on a breadboard.
Build and test the output of the full wave center tap rectifier on a breadboard.
Build and test the full wave bridge rectifier on a breadboard.
Test the performance of half and full wave rectifier with shunt capacitor filter.
Test the performance of the zener diode and obtain the Zener breakdown (Reverse) voltage and current.
Build and test zener voltage regulator for the given regulated voltage.
Test the performance of LED in series and shunt connection and measure the current and voltage in both the connections.
Test the performance of Photodiode and obtain reverse voltage drop and diode current with change in light intensity.
Test common emitter transistor configuration and obtain the value of current gain and input impedance.
Test common base transistor configuration and obtain the value of current gain and input impedance.
Test common collector transistor configuration and obtain the value of current gain and input impedance.
Build and test common emitter amplifier and obtain the value of voltage gain for given input signal.

performanceIndicators.indicator: Follow the procedure to complete the connections and take readings.
Interpret the result and conclude the work.

hardware: Dual variable DC power supply: 0-30V, 2A, With Short circuit protection, separate display for voltage and current
Cathode Ray Oscilloscope: Dual Trace 20Mhz, 1MegaÎ© Input Impedance
Function Generator 0-2 MHz with Sine, square and triangular output with variable frequency and amplitude
Digital Multimeter: 3 1/2 digit display, 1999 count digital multimeter measures: Vac, Vdc (600V max), Adc, Aac (10 amp max), Resistance (0 - 2 Mega Ohm), with diode and transistor tester
LCR meter bench top or hand-held type, 3 1/2 digit LCD /LED display, 1999 count, Resistance 0-20 Mega Ohm, Capacitance 0-200 micro Farad, Inductance 0 - 20 Henry

Electronic Workbench: Bread Board 840-1000 contact points: Positive and Negative DC power rails on opposite sides of the board with 0-30 V, 2 Amp Variable DC power supply, Function Generator 0-2MHz, CRO 0-30MHz, Digital Multimeter

affectiveDomainOutcomes: Work as a leader/a team member.
Practice environmentally friendly methods and processes.
studentActivities: Prepare a table and interpret the technical specification of various diodes and transistors using data sheet.
Prepare specifications of some electronic components.
Collect information and seminar on any relevant topic related with the course.
Undertake a market survey of different semiconductor components.
Prepare a survey report different electronic waste management adopted by the local electronics industry.
Undertake a survey of CPCB/GPCB authorized E-Waste handling agencies.
Undertake a visit to e-waste handling plant nearby and prepare a report.
instructionalStrategies: Massive open online courses (MOOCs) may be used to teach various topics/sub topics.
'L' in section No. 4 means different types of teaching methods that are to be employed by teachers to develop the outcomes.
About 20% of the topics/sub-topics which are relatively simpler or descriptive in nature is to be given to the students for self-learning, but to be assessed using different assessment methods.
With respect to section No.10, teachers need to ensure to create opportunities and provisions for co-curricular activities.
Guide students on how to address issues on environment and sustainability
Guide students for finding proper active and passive components using datasheet manuals and websites for electronic application

microProjects.title: Diode
microProjects.description: Build a circuit on general purpose PCB or breadboard to obtain +12V unregulated DC power supply using full wave bridge rectifier and filter (Duration: 8-10 hours)

microProjects.title: Photodiode
microProjects.description: Build a interruption detector circuit to blink an LED using LDR, and prepare a mini project report. (Duration: 6-8 hours)

microProjects.title: Transistor Amplifier
microProjects.description: a common emitter amplifier using transistor and prepare a mini project report. (Duration: 6-8 hours)

microProjects.title: Transistor Application
microProjects.description: Build a transistorized water level indicator and prepare a mini project report. (Duration: 6-8 hours)

microProjects.title: Special Purpose Diodes
microProjects.description: Build basic applications using any one or combination of special purpose diodes, and prepare a mini project report. (Duration: 6-8 hours)

microProjects.title: Electronic Waste
microProjects.description: Prepare a report of strategies regarding handling of electronic waste with figures, tables and comparative charts.

programOutcomes.description: Engineering practices for society, sustainability & environment
